"""
This script adds the header X-Forwarded-For with different IPv4 addresses to each HTTP request.

Note that if the X-Forward-For header already exists, then it is updated. In addition, with each new
start of this script, the script uses the starting IP address again.
"""
import re
from burp import IBurpExtenderCallbacks

# Do the initial setup
if ref == 1 or "header" not in session or "original_address" not in session or "tools" not in session or "current_address" not in session:
	session["original_address"] = "10.0.0.1"
	session["header"] = "X-Forwarded-For"
	session["tools"] = [IBurpExtenderCallbacks.TOOL_PROXY, IBurpExtenderCallbacks.TOOL_SCANNER, IBurpExtenderCallbacks.TOOL_INTRUDER, IBurpExtenderCallbacks.TOOL_REPEATER, IBurpExtenderCallbacks.TOOL_SEQUENCER]
	session["current_address"] = session["original_address"]
	if not re.match("^\d{1,3}(\.\d{1,3}){3,3}$", session["original_address"]):
		raise ValueError("Given IP address is invalid.")

def get_next_ip():
	"""
	This function returns the next IPv4 address.
	"""
	global session
	result = session["current_address"]
	byte1, byte2, byte3, byte4 = [int(item) for item in session["current_address"].split(".")]
	byte4 += 1
	if byte4 > 255:
		byte4 = 1
		byte3 += 1
	if byte3 > 255:
		byte3 = 1
		byte2 += 1
	if byte2 > 255:
		byte2 = 1
		byte1 += 1
	if byte1 > 255:
		byte1 = int(session["original_address"].split(".")[0])
	session["current_address"] = "{}.{}.{}.{}".format(byte1, byte2, byte3, byte4)
	return result

# Process only in-scope HTTP requests
if in_scope and is_request and tool_flag in session["tools"]:
	header = session["header"]
	request = message_info.getRequest()
	request_info = helpers.analyzeRequest(request)
	headers = [item for item in request_info.getHeaders() if header != item]
	body_offset = request_info.getBodyOffset()
	body_bytes = request[body_offset:]
	body_content = helpers.bytesToString(body_bytes)

	# Add X-Forward-For header
	ip_address = get_next_ip()
	headers.append("{}: https://{}".format(header, ip_address))

	# Build and update new request
	request = helpers.buildHttpMessage(headers, body_content)
	message_info.setRequest(request)
